record.creatorPhotographer: William A. Hiltner and Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar
record.description: Total solar eclipse July 9 photographed by University of Chicago astronomers and professors Hiltner and Chandrasekhar at a remote site in Manitoba, Canada, 1,200 miles north of Chicago. Taken with a six-inch telescope camera, exposure 14 seconds, showing the full corona. The longest white blur away from the solar ball is along the sun's equatorial axis and extends two million miles into space. According to the astronomers, the corona was irregular, probably because the Northern Lights (aurora) had been playing about the heavens in that region in the days before the eclipse.
